W3C RDF Stream Processing Community Group

URL:
[1]
Description:
The mission of the RDF Stream Processing Community Group (RSP) is to define a common model for producing, transmitting and continuously querying RDF Streams. This includes extensions to both RDF and SPARQL for representing streaming data, as well as their semantics
Start date:
September 2013
Due date:
--
Current status of the group:
Ongoing
Role in the group:
Three members of the OEG (Oscar Corcho, Alejandro Llaves, Javier Fernández) are participating in the biweekly discussions and writing of the final report.
Enrolled:
Additional information:
Outcome:
W3C Semantic Sensor Network Incubator Group

URL:
[2]
Description:
The mission of the Semantic Sensor Network Incubator Group, part of the Incubator Activity, was to begin the formal process of producing ontologies that define the capabilities of sensors and sensor networks, and to develop semantic annotations of a key language used by services based sensor networks.
Start date:
March 2009
Due date:
September 2010
Current status of the group:
Finished
Role in the group:
Two members of the OEG (Raúl García Castro and Óscar Corcho) participated in the weekly discussions, development of use cases, development of the semantic sensor network ontology, and writing of the final report.
Enrolled:
Additional information:
The group's
Final Report
summarizes the activities of the group.
The group's
wiki
.
The
SSN ontology
.
Outcome:
“Final Report of the W3C Semantic Sensor Network Incubator Group.” Laurent Lefort, Cory Henson, Payam Barnaghi, Michael Compton, Oscar Corcho, Raúl García-Castro, John Graybeal, Arthur Herzog, Krzysztof Janowicz, Holger Neuhaus, Andriy Nikolov, Kevin Page, and Kerry Taylor. Available from
http://www.w3.org/2005/Incubator/ssn/wiki/Incubator_Report
.
W3C Provenance Incubator Group

URL:
Wiki of the group
Description:
The mission of the Provenance Incubator Group, part of the Incubator Activity, is to provide a state-of-the art understanding and develop a roadmap in the area of provenance for Semantic Web technologies, development, and possible standardization. See the charter for more information. The group's activities are public, and are recorded on the W3C Provenance Incubator Group wiki.
Start date:
21-09-2009
Due date:
11-2010
Current status of the group:
Finished
Role in the group:
To participate in the weekly discussions, to help developing the requirements for the scenarios, to help developing the bibliography collection in provenance and to participate and to review the final report.
Enrolled:
07-05-2010
Aditional information:
The group's
Final Report
summarizes the activities of the group and also proposes a new Working Group for Provenance, with a 2 year charter.
Outcome:
“Final Report of the W3C Provenance Incubator Group.” Yolanda Gil, James Cheney, Paul Groth, Olaf Hartig, Simon Miles, Luc Moreau, and Paolo Pinheiro da Silva. Report from the W3C Provenance Incubator Group, first release: November 30, 2010.  Available from
http://www.w3.org/2005/Incubator/prov/XGR-prov-20101214/
“Towards Provenance Interoperability: Defining Mappings between Provenance Terminologies.” Satya Sahoo, Paul Groth, Olaf Hartig, Simon Miles, Sam Coppens, James Myers, Yolanda Gil, Luc Moreau, Jun Zhao, Michael Panzer, and Daniel Garijo. Submitted to the Journal Web of Semantics. 2010. Available from
http://www.w3.org/2005/Incubator/prov/wiki/Provenance_Vocabulary_Mappings
W3C RDB2RDF Working Group

URL:
RDB2RDF Working Group Charter
Description:
The mission of the RDB2RDF Working Group, part of the Semantic Web Activity, is to standardize a language for mapping relational data and relational database schemas into RDF and OWL, tentatively called the RDB2RDF Mapping Language, R2RML.
Start date:
30 September 2009
Due date:
30 September 2011
Current status of the group:
Open
Role in the group:
Effective participation to RDB2RDF Working Group is expected to consume one work day per week for each participant; two days per week for editors. The RDB2RDF Working Group will allocate also the necessary resources for building Test Suites for each specification.
Enrolled:
10-05-2010
Aditional information:
Communication:
This group primarily conducts its work on the public mailing list public-rdb2rdf-wg at w3.org.
Working documents:
R2RML: RDB to RDF Mapping Language
A Direct Mapping of Relational Data to RDF
R2RML Test Cases
W3C SPARQL Working Group

URL:
SPARQL Working Group
Description:
The mission of the SPARQL Working Group, part of the Semantic Web Activity, is to develop SPARQL, the query language for the Semantic Web. The scope of this charter is to extend SPARQL technology to include some of the features that the community has identified as both desirable and important for interoperability based on experience with the initial version of the standard.
Start date:
July 2009
Due date:
31 July 2011
Current status of the group:
Open
Role in the group:
Editor of the SPARQL 1.1 Basic Federated Query.
Enrolled:
21-07-2010
Aditional information:
Communication:
This group primarily conducts its work on the public mailing list public-rdf-dawg and public-rdf-dawg-comments at w3.org.
Working documents:
SPARQL 1.1 Query
Update
Protocol
Service Description
Describes the use of the HTTP protocol for managing named RDF graphs on an HTTP server.
Entailment
Property Paths
Basic Federated Query
W3C eGovernment Interest Group

URL:
eGovernment Interest Group Charter
Description:
The mission of the eGovernment Interest Group, part of the eGovernment Activity, is to document, advocate, coordinate and communicate best practices, solutions and approaches to improve the interface between citizens and government through effective standards-based use of the Web. See the charter for more information.
Start date:
Due date:
Current status of the group:
Close?
Role in the group:
TBD
Enrolled:
W3C Library Linked Data Incubator Group

URL:
Library Linked Data Incubator Group wiki
Description:
The mission of the Library Linked Data incubator group is to help increase global interoperability of library data on the Web, by bringing together people involved in Semantic Web activities—focusing on Linked Data—in the library community and beyond, building on existing initiatives, and identifying collaboration tracks for the future.
Start date:
05-2010
Due date:
20-05-2011
Current status of the group:
Open
Role in the group:
To participate in the weekly discussions, to help developing the requirements for the scenarios, to help developing the bibliography collection.
Enrolled:
08-03-2011
W3C Media Annotations Working Group

URL:
Media Annotations Working Group Charter
Description:
The mission of the Media Annotations Working Group, part of the Video in the Web Activity, is to provide an ontology and API designed to facilitate cross-community data integration of information related to media objects in the Web, such as video, audio and images.
Start date:
September 2008
Due date:
30 June 2011
Current status of the group:
Open
Role in the group:
One member of the OEG (Mari Carmen Suárez-Figueroa) is currently participating in the weekly discussions, the development of the media ontology, and the revision of working reports.
Enrolled:
November 2010
W3C Semantic Web Health Care and Life Sciences (HCLS) Interest Group
speaker: SYSTEM
